observer.translation[0].definitions[0].d: someone who regularly watches or pays attention to particular things, events, situations etc
observer.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Observers are predicting a fall in interest rates.
observer.translation[0].definitions[1].d: someone who attends meetings, classes, events etc to check what is happening
observer.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The UN sent observers to the peace talks.
observer.translation[0].definitions[2].d: someone who sees or looks at something
observer.translation[0].definitions[2].e: reports from observers at sea and on dry land
A casual observer would have guessed his age at 70.
observer.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a serious British Sunday newspaper which generally supports fairly left-wing political ideas. The Observer  is owned by the same company that owns The Guardian.
